title.narrative: NUTRITION(03)CARE FOR CHILDREN WITH SEVERE ACUTE MALNUTRITION (SAM)

description.narrative: Care for children with severe acute malnutrition (SAM)UNICEF regional offices and country offices have enhanced strategic and technical capacity to support countries in providing care for children with severe acute malnutrition (SAM), leaving no one behind., which contributes to Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Every Child to Survive and Thrive By 2021, countries apply child-sensitive policies, innovative community-centered approaches and evidence, to implement development and humanitarian interventions at scale, that enable Every Child to Survive and Thrive

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF House 3 United Nations Plaza New York New York 10017 USA

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Care for children with severe acute malnutrition (SAM)UNICEF regional offices and country offices have enhanced strategic andtechnical capacity to support countries in providing care for children with severe acute malnutrition (SAM), leaving no one behind.

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF succeeded in screening over 150 million children and providing treatment to 5.4 million children with severe wasting around the world – an increase of over 400,000 compared to 2020. UNICEF also coordinated the launch of the Global Action Plan on Child Wasting, the first-ever global roadmap to achieve the Sustainable Development Goals on child wasting and provide universal treatment in over 20 high-burden countries around the world. ; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/03/2022

title.narrative: Number of countries committing to scale up care for 6 million children with SAM per year(57606)
